summary: A confidential memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York dated August 12, 2019, documenting information passed from the Special Housing Unit on August 9, 2019, regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's status and need for a cellmate after an attorney visit.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate referenced in the memorandum, identified by his inmate number #76318-054, who was going to WAB (likely 'Ward Administration Building' or similar) and would need a cellmate upon return from an attorney visit.

persons.name: Warde
persons.context: The person to whom the memorandum is addressed, presumably a staff member or official at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: S/O/S
persons.context: The author or sender of the memorandum, identified by the initials S/O/S, who passed on information from the Special Housing Unit regarding inmate Epstein.

persons.name: Officer
persons.context: An oncoming staff member and present shift staff officer mentioned as receiving the passed information about inmate Epstein.

connections.description: S/O/S passed information to the oncoming staff member Officer regarding inmate Epstein's status.
S/O/S authored a memorandum to Warde documenting the information passed about inmate Epstein.

events.title: Information passed about Epstein's status
events.description: On August 9, 2019, at approximately 1:50 p.m., information was passed from the Special Housing Unit to oncoming staff that inmate Jeffrey Epstein was going to WAB and might not return, and that he would need a cellmate upon arrival from his attorney visit.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is a confidential government memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York dated August 12, 2019.
It records information passed on August 9, 2019, regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein's movement to WAB and his need for a cellmate after an attorney visit.
Jeffrey Epstein is identified by his inmate number #76318-054.
The memorandum highlights internal prison communications about Epstein's status shortly before his death.
